snippet: Seeking to pierce one of President Obama's strongest arguments, Mitt Romney highlights an auto dealer who lost his business after the bailout. A new Obama spot also hits a traditional Republican strength: military spending.
abstract: Seeking to pierce one of President Obama's strongest arguments, Mitt Romney highlights an auto dealer who lost his business after the bailout. A new Obama spot also hits a traditional Republican strength: military spending.

headline.main: New Romney Ad Hits Obama on Layoffs After Auto Bailout
